tuv.prop: Many of God's people are in danger of being ensnared by worldliness and covetousness.

tuv.seg: They should understand that it is His mercy that multiplies the demands for their means.

tuv.prop: If you will go to work in earnest, ways will open before you for the accomplishment of this work.

tuv.seg: But this great sacrifice was not made in order to create in the Father’s heart a love for man, not to make Him willing to save.

tuv.prop: Behold Him in the wilderness, in Gethsemane, upon the cross!
He who had been one with God, felt in His soul the awful separation that sin makes between God and man.
tuv.seg: The spotless Son of God took upon Himself the burden of sin.

tuv.prop: The world, though fallen, is not all sorrow and misery.
There are flowers upon the thistles, and the thorns are covered with roses. {SC 9.3}
tuv.seg: In nature itself are messages of hope and comfort.

tuv.prop: The price paid for our redemption, the infinite sacrifice of our heavenly Father in giving His Son to die for us,

As the inspired apostle John beheld the height, the depth, the breadth of the Father’s love toward the perishing race, he was filled with adoration and reverence; and, failing to find suitable language in which to express the greatness and tenderness of this love, he called upon the world to behold it.
tuv.seg: should give us exalted conceptions of what we may become through Christ.

tuv.prop: and how sayest thou then, Show us the Father?”

In describing His earthly mission, Jesus said, The Lord “hath anointed Me to preach the gospel to the poor; He hath sent Me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised.” (Luke 4:18.)
He gave Him not only to live among men, to bear their sins, and die their sacrifice.
Christ was to identify Himself with the interests and needs of humanity.

tuv.prop: Love, mercy, and compassion were revealed in every act of His life;

tuv.prop: He who was one with God has linked Himself with the children of men by ties that are never to be broken.
He is our Sacrifice, our Advocate, our Brother, bearing our human form before the Father’s throne, and through eternal ages one with the race He has redeemed--the Son of man.
tuv.seg: Jesus is “not ashamed to call them brethren” (Hebrews 2:11);
“Yesu maiv nyaiv heuc ninh mbuo zoux gorx-youz.” (Hipv^lu 2:11.)

tuv.prop: The principle of worldlings is to get, get, and thus they expect to secure happiness; but, carried out in all its bearings, the fruit is misery and death. {CS 14.2}
It should not be a lamented fact that there are increasing calls to give.
tuv.seg: The light of the gospel shining from the cross of Christ rebukes selfishness, and encourages liberality and benevolence.

tuv.prop: Shall we not do all we can to give power to the principles which Christ brought to this world?
As you stand before the cross, and see the Prince of heaven dying for you, can you seal your heart, saying, “No; I have nothing to give”? {CS 16.1}
tuv.seg: Shall we not strive to establish and give efficiency to the benevolent enterprises which are now called for without delay?

#Chapter 2

tuv.prop: He did not censure human weakness.
He denounced hypocrisy, unbelief, and iniquity;
tuv.seg: He spoke the truth, but always in love.
Ziouv Yesu gorngv zien leiz, mv baac Ninh haaix zanc gorngv se yiem Ninh hnamv mienh nyei hnyouv gorngv cuotv.

tuv.prop: He wept over Jerusalem, the city He loved,
They had rejected Him, the Saviour, but He regarded them with pitying tenderness.
tuv.seg: which refused to receive Him, the way, the truth, and the life.
Naaiv norm zingh maiv kangv zipv Ninh, maiv gunv Ninh se dongh mingh Zaangc Diex wuov diuh jauv, yaac dongh zien leiz, yaac dongh ziangh maengc.

tuv.prop: By a chain of circumstances which would call forth his charities, He bestows upon man the best means of cultivating benevolence, and keeps him habitually giving to help the poor and to advance His cause.
And as we heed these calls, by labor and by acts of benevolence, we are assimilated to the image of Him who for our sakes became poor.
tuv.seg: By its necessities a ruined world is drawing forth from us talents of means and of influence, to present to men and women the truth, of which they are in perishing need.
ພັນທະກິດນີ້ຈຶ່ງມີຄວາມຈໍາເປັນຢ່າງຍິ່ງສໍາລັບໂລກທີ່ກໍາລັງເສື່ອມໂຊມ ແລະພວກເຮົາຖຶກເອິ້ນໃຫ້ໃຊ້ຄວາມສາມາດ ແລະອິດທິຜົນຂອງພວກເຮົາໃນການແບ່ງປັນຄວາມຈິງກັບຜູ້ຄົນທີ່ຕ້ອງການມັນ.

tuv.prop: Even little children were attracted to Him.
Jesus did not suppress one word of truth,
tuv.seg: They loved to climb upon His knees and gaze into the pensive face, benignant with love. {SC 11.2}

tuv.prop: It is transgression of God’s law--the law of love--that has brought woe and death.
It is written that God cursed the ground for man’s sake. (Genesis 3:17.)
tuv.seg: Yet even amid the suffering that results from sin, God’s love is revealed.
Mv baac yiem zuiz bun daaih nyei naanc zingh mbu’ndongx mbuo corc mangc duqv buatc Tin-Hungh maaih hnyouv hnamv mienh.

tuv.prop: “God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto Himself.” (2 Corinthians 5:19).
In the agony of Gethsemane, the death of Calvary, the heart of Infinite Love paid the price of our redemption. {SC 13.2}

tuv.prop: God could have reached His object in saving sinners without the aid of man; but He knew that man could not be happy without acting a part in the great work.
tuv.seg: That man might not lose the blessed results of benevolence, our Redeemer formed the plan of enlisting him as His coworker.
ເພື່ອວ່າມະນຸດຈະບໍ່ໄດ້ສູນເສຍພຣະພອນອັນເນື່ອງມາຈາກການຖະວາຍບໍລິຈາກ, ພຣະຜູ້ໄຖ່ຂອງພວກເຮົາໄດ້ຊົງວາງແຜນການ ໂດຍຄັດເລືອກໃຫ້ພວກເຮົາມາເປັນຄູ່ຮ່ວມງານກັບພຣະອົງ.

tuv.prop: He went about doing good and healing all that were oppressed by Satan.
tuv.seg: This was His work.
Naaiv se Ziouv Yesu nyei gong.

tuv.prop: It was to redeem us that Jesus lived and suffered and died.
God permitted His beloved Son, full of grace and truth, to come from a world of indescribable glory, to a world marred and blighted with sin, darkened with the shadow of death and the curse.
tuv.seg: He became “a Man of Sorrows,” that we might be made partakers of everlasting joy.
Ninh “zuqc diev mun;” yie mbuo ziouc haih maaih buonc yiem yietc liuz nyei njien-youh.

tuv.prop: The gift of Christ reveals the Father's heart.
The spirit of liberality is the spirit of heaven.
tuv.seg: It testifies that, having undertaken our redemption, He will spare nothing, however dear, which is necessary to the completion of His work. {CS 14.1}

tuv.prop: He pictured the Creator as a being who is watching with jealous eye to discern the errors and mistakes of men, that He may visit judgments upon them.
The Son of God came from heaven to make manifest the Father.
tuv.seg: It was to remove this dark shadow, by revealing to the world the infinite love of God, that Jesus came to live among men. {SC 10.3}

tuv.prop: We yearn after Him, and for that fullness that is in Him, and that shines out in the perfection of His heavenly character;
tuv.seg: and by beholding we become changed into His image.”

tuv.prop: Jesus said, “Therefore doth My Father love Me, because I lay down My life, that I might take it again.” (John 10:17).
tuv.seg: In the agony of Gethsemane, the death of Calvary, the heart of Infinite Love paid the price of our redemption. {SC 13.2}
Ziouv Yesu diev kouv yiem Getc^se^maa^ni Huingx, yaac yiem Kaan^waa^li Mbong daic weic zuoqc mbuo nzuonx wuov zanc, Tin-Hungh ganh yaac haiz hnyouv mun. {SC 13.2}

tuv.prop: There are flowers upon the thistles, and the thorns are covered with roses. {SC 9.3}

The lovely birds making the air vocal with their happy songs, the delicately tinted flowers in their perfection perfuming the air, the lofty trees of the forest with their rich foliage of living green--all testify to the tender, fatherly care of our God and to His desire to make His children happy. {SC 10.1}
tuv.seg: “God is love” is written upon every opening bud, upon every spire of springing grass.
Diuh diuh miev-maeng caux norm-norm biangh biux mengh Tin-Hungh zoux hnamv mienh nyei gorn.

tuv.prop: He became “a Man of Sorrows,” that we might be made partakers of everlasting joy.
He permitted Him to leave the bosom of His love, the adoration of the angels, to suffer shame, insult, humiliation, hatred, and death.
tuv.seg: God permitted His beloved Son, full of grace and truth, to come from a world of indescribable glory, to a world marred and blighted with sin, darkened with the shadow of death and the curse.

Tin-Hungh nqoi nzuih bun Ninh maaih en-ceix caux zien leiz buangv nzengc nyei Dorn-hnamv leih maaih njang-laangc nyei tin-dorngh njiec taux zuqc zuiz baaic huv baaic waaic nyei baamh gen se zuqc daic zuqc houv zuqc zioux nyei dongh linh ormx jienv nyei baamh gen.

tuv.prop: He did not censure human weakness.
He denounced hypocrisy, unbelief, and iniquity; but tears were in His voice as He uttered His scathing rebukes.
tuv.seg: He spoke the truth, but always in love.
Ziouv Yesu gorngv zien leiz, mv baac Ninh haaix zanc gorngv se yiem Ninh hnamv mienh nyei hnyouv gorngv cuotv.

tuv.prop: but He uttered it always in love.
He was never rude, never needlessly spoke a severe word,
tuv.seg: He exercised the greatest tact and thoughtful, kind attention in His intercourse with the people.
Ninh zanc-zanc dorh leiz nyei gorngv waac yaac zoux hnyouv longx bun zuangx mienh.

tuv.prop: He gave Him to the fallen race.
He who was one with God has linked Himself with the children of men by ties that are never to be broken.
tuv.seg: Christ was to identify Himself with the interests and needs of humanity.
Giduc ganh oix zuqc daaih benx yietc dauh baamh mienh. Oix zuqc ganh yiem sin haiz qiemx zuqc nyanc, qiemx zuqc hopv, qiemx zuqc bueix m’njormh.

tuv.prop: The spotless Son of God took upon Himself the burden of sin.
This wrung from His lips the anguished cry, “My God, My God, why hast Thou forsaken Me?” (Matthew 27:46.)
tuv.seg: He who had been one with God, felt in His soul the awful separation that sin makes between God and man.

tuv.prop: The light of the gospel shining from the cross of Christ rebukes selfishness, and encourages liberality and benevolence.
God in His providence is calling His people out from their limited sphere of action, to enter upon greater enterprises.
tuv.seg: It should not be a lamented fact that there are increasing calls to give.

tuv.prop: Shall we not strive to establish and give efficiency to the benevolent enterprises which are now called for without delay?
Christ's believing people are to perpetuate His love.
tuv.seg: As you stand before the cross, and see the Prince of heaven dying for you, can you seal your heart, saying, “No; I have nothing to give”? {CS 16.1}

tuv.prop: By assuming human nature, Christ elevates humanity.
Such love is without a parallel.
tuv.seg: Fallen men are placed where, through connection with Christ, they may indeed become worthy of the name “sons of God.” {SC 15.1}

tuv.prop: That man might be saved, He gave all that He had, and then gave Himself.
The principle there illustrated is to give, give.
tuv.seg: The cross of Christ appeals to the benevolence of every follower of the blessed Saviour.

tuv.prop: This love is to draw them together around the cross.
Meet around the cross of Calvary in self-sacrifice and self-denial.
tuv.seg: It is to divest them of all selfishness, and bind them to God and to one another. {CS 16.2}

tuv.prop: It was to remove this dark shadow, by revealing to the world the infinite love of God, that Jesus came to live among men. {SC 10.3}
“No man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, He hath declared Him.”
tuv.seg: The Son of God came from heaven to make manifest the Father.
Tin-Hungh nyei dorn yiem tin-dorngh njiec daaih weic bun cing Zaangc Diex.

tuv.prop: Only He who knew the height and depth of the love of God could make it manifest.
“God so loved the world, that He gave His only-begotten Son.”
tuv.seg: Nothing less than the infinite sacrifice made by Christ in behalf of fallen man could express the Father’s love to lost humanity. {SC 14.2}

tuv.seg: This is the character of God.

tuv.seg: God will bless you as you do your best.

tuv.prop: Yet these but imperfectly represent His love.
Satan led men to conceive of God as a being whose chief attribute is stern justice,--one who is a severe judge, a harsh, exacting creditor.
tuv.seg: Though all these evidences have been given, the enemy of good blinded the minds of men, so that they looked upon God with fear; they thought of Him as severe and unforgiving.

tuv.prop: That man might not lose the blessed results of benevolence, our Redeemer formed the plan of enlisting him as His coworker.

By a chain of circumstances which would call forth his charities, He bestows upon man the best means of cultivating benevolence, and keeps him habitually giving to help the poor and to advance His cause.
tuv.seg: God could have reached His object in saving sinners without the aid of man; but He knew that man could not be happy without acting a part in the great work.

The matchless love of God for a world that did not love Him!

The more we study the divine character in the light of the cross, the more we see mercy, tenderness, and forgiveness blended with equity and justice, and the more clearly we discern innumerable evidences of a love that is infinite and a tender pity surpassing a mother’s yearning sympathy for her wayward child. {SC 15.2}

tuv.prop: “God is love” is written upon every opening bud, upon every spire of springing grass.
the delicately tinted flowers in their perfection perfuming the air,
tuv.seg: The lovely birds making the air vocal with their happy songs,
Ndaamh lungh nyei norqc baaux kuv muangx haic nyei nzung.

tuv.prop: None but the Son of God could accomplish our redemption; for only He who was in the bosom of the Father could declare Him.
Nothing less than the infinite sacrifice made by Christ in behalf of fallen man could express the Father’s love to lost humanity. {SC 14.2}
tuv.seg: Only He who knew the height and depth of the love of God could make it manifest.
Dongh hiuv duqv Tin-Hungh maaih hnyouv hnamv mienh ndongc haaix jangv ndongc haaix ndo wuov dauh hnangv haih biux mengh bun mienh hiuv.

tuv.prop: The Son of God came from heaven to make manifest the Father.
tuv.seg: “No man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, He hath declared Him.”
“Maiv maaih haaix dauh buatc jiex Tin-Hungh. Kungx maaih ninh nyei ndoqc Dorn, dongh yiem Zaangc Diex nyei ga’hlen wuov dauh, bun mbuo hiuv duqv Tin-Hungh hnangv.”

tuv.prop: The more light we have, the more we can impart to others around us.
As we behold Him in His purity, we discern more clearly our own faults of character.
tuv.seg: The more closely we live to Jesus, the clearer views shall we have of His loveliness.

tuv.prop: In commissioning His disciples to go “into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature,” Christ assigned to men the work of extending the knowledge of His grace.
He has placed means in the hands of men, that His divine gifts may flow through human channels in doing the work appointed us in saving our fellow men.
tuv.seg: But while some go forth to preach, He calls upon others to answer His claims upon them for offerings, with which to support His cause in the earth.

tuv.prop: But while some go forth to preach, He calls upon others to answer His claims upon them for offerings, with which to support His cause in the earth.
tuv.seg: In commissioning His disciples to go “into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature,” Christ assigned to men the work of extending the knowledge of His grace.

tuv.prop: God permitted His beloved Son, full of grace and truth, to come from a world of indescribable glory, to a world marred and blighted with sin, darkened with the shadow of death and the curse.
“The chastisement of our peace was upon Him; and with His stripes we are healed.” (Isaiah 53:5.)
tuv.seg: He permitted Him to leave the bosom of His love, the adoration of the angels, to suffer shame, insult, humiliation, hatred, and death.

Tin-Hungh nqoi nzuih bun Ziouv Yesu leih Ninh hnamv haic nyei Zaangc Diex caux zuangx fin-mienh fu-sux liuc leiz, weic mingh diev nyaiv, diev mienh mangc maiv faaux mueic, diev ganh zuqc baaic hmien, zuqc mienh nzorng, yaac zuqc daic.

tuv.prop: God in His providence is calling His people out from their limited sphere of action, to enter upon greater enterprises.
Many of God's people are in danger of being ensnared by worldliness and covetousness.
tuv.seg: Unlimited effort is demanded at this time when moral darkness is covering the world.
ຄວາມພະຍາຍາມບໍ່ຈໍາກັດແມ່ນຕ້ອງການໃນເວລານີ້ໃນເວລາທີ່ຄວາມມືດທາງສິນທໍາກໍາລັງປົກຄຸມໂລກ.

tuv.prop: Look at the wonderful and beautiful things of nature.
The sunshine and the rain, that gladden and refresh the earth, the hills and seas and plains, all speak to us of the Creator’s love.
tuv.seg: Think of their marvelous adaptation to the needs and happiness, not only of man, but of all living creatures.

Tin-Hungh zeix daaih nyei nyungc horngh bun mienh maaih ninh mbuo qiemx zuqc longc nyei maanc muotc, yaac tengx mienh njien-youh. Maiv zeiz mienh hnangv, mv baac Tin-Hungh bun saeng-kuv hieh zoih buangh zuqc ninh mbuo qiemx zuqc longc nyei nyungc-nyungc.

tuv.prop: Jesus said, “Therefore doth My Father love Me, because I lay down My life, that I might take it again.” (John 10:17).

In becoming your Substitute and Surety, by surrendering My life, by taking your liabilities, your transgressions, I am endeared to My Father; for by My sacrifice, God can be just, and yet the Justifier of him who believeth in Jesus.” {SC 14.1}
tuv.seg: That is, “My Father has so loved you that He even loves Me more for giving My life to redeem you.
Eix leiz se, ‘Yie nyei Zaangc Diex hnamv meih mbuo ndongc naaic camv, Ninh cingx daaih hnamv yie jaa camv jienv faaux laaix yie siev yie ganh nyei maengc weic zuoqc meih mbuo nzuonx.

tuv.prop: The poor are His, and the cause of religion is His.
But instead of this He has made man His steward, entrusting him with means, not to be hoarded, but to be used in benefiting others.
tuv.seg: The gold and the silver are the Lord's; and He could rain them from heaven if He chose.
ຄໍາແລະເງິນເປັນຂອງພຣະຜູ້ເປັນເຈົ້າ;ແລະພຣະອົງສາມາດຝົນພວກເຂົາຈາກສະຫວັນຖ້າພຣະອົງເລືອກ.

tuv.prop: the lofty trees of the forest with their rich foliage of living green--
The word of God reveals His character.
tuv.seg: all testify to the tender, fatherly care of our God and to His desire to make His children happy. {SC 10.1}
Naaiv deix yietc zungv zoux zorng-zengx gorngv Zaangc Diex ziux goux Ninh nyei fu’jueiv yaac oix ninh mbuo maaih njien-youh. {SC 10.1}

tuv.prop: In bestowing, we bless others, and thus accumulate true riches. {CS 13.5}
This work began in the heavenly courts.
tuv.seg: It is the glory of the gospel that it is founded upon the principle of restoring in the fallen race the divine image by a constant manifestation of benevolence.
ຂ່າວປະເສີດມີຄວາມສະຫງ່າລາສີເພາະຕັ້ງຢູ່ບົນພື້ນຖານຂອງແນວຄວາມຄິດໃນການຟື້ນຟູພຣະລັກສະນະຂອງເຈົ້າໃນມະນຸດ ໂດຍການສະແດງຄວາມເມດຕາກະລຸນາຢ່າງສະໝໍ່າສະເໝີ.

tuv.prop: Fallen men are placed where, through connection with Christ, they may indeed become worthy of the name “sons of God.” {SC 15.1}
Children of the heavenly King! Precious promise!
tuv.seg: Such love is without a parallel.
Maiv maaih haaix dauh hnamv mienh ndongc Tin-Hungh hnamv.

tuv.prop: As the inspired apostle John beheld the height, the depth, the breadth of the Father’s love toward the perishing race,
and, failing to find suitable language in which to express the greatness and tenderness of this love, he called upon the world to behold it.
tuv.seg: he was filled with adoration and reverence;
Ninh ziouc haiz hnamv yaac taaih Tin-Hungh.

tuv.prop: His work gave evidence of His divine anointing.
His heart went out in tender sympathy to the children of men.
tuv.seg: Love, mercy, and compassion were revealed in every act of His life;
Ninh yiem seix zaangc zoux nyei nyungc-nyungc biux mengh Ninh hnamv mienh yaac korv-lienh mienh.

tuv.prop: The lovely birds making the air vocal with their happy songs,
the lofty trees of the forest with their rich foliage of living green--
tuv.seg: the delicately tinted flowers in their perfection perfuming the air,
Ndau-beih nyei biangh ndomh mau yaac nzueic bungx ndaang nyei qiex buangv lomc-ndiev.

tuv.prop: He was never rude, never needlessly spoke a severe word,
He did not censure human weakness.
tuv.seg: never gave needless pain to a sensitive soul.
Se gorngv maiv maaih gorn-baengx nor, ninh yaac maiv bun hnyouv mau nyei mienh zuqc mun.

tuv.prop: to set at liberty them that are bruised.”

tuv.prop: He who gives to the needy blesses others, and is blessed himself in a still greater degree. {CS 13.4}
That man might not lose the blessed results of benevolence, our Redeemer formed the plan of enlisting him as His coworker.
tuv.seg: ##The Glory of the Gospel

tuv.prop: The spirit of liberality is the spirit of heaven.
That man might be saved, He gave all that He had, and then gave Himself.
tuv.seg: Christ's self-sacrificing love is revealed upon the cross.

tuv.prop: He exercised the greatest tact and thoughtful, kind attention in His intercourse with the people.
never gave needless pain to a sensitive soul.

tuv.prop: The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.”
“The liberal deviseth liberal things; and by liberal things shall he stand.”
tuv.seg: Proverbs 11:24, 25. {CS 13.2}

tuv.prop: This wrung from His lips the anguished cry, “My God, My God, why hast Thou forsaken Me?” (Matthew 27:46.)
But this great sacrifice was not made in order to create in the Father’s heart a love for man, not to make Him willing to save.
tuv.seg: It was the burden of sin, the sense of its terrible enormity, of its separation of the soul from God--it was this that broke the heart of the Son of God. {SC 13.1}
Ninh ndaam baamh mienh nyei zuiz youc hlo youc hniev, ziouc nqaeqv jienv bun Ninh leih go Tin-Hungh, yaac zoux bun Tin-Hungh nyei Dorn hnyouv mun, mba’nziu mbaaix. {SC 13.1}

tuv.prop: Christ was the medium through which He could pour out His infinite love upon a fallen world.
tuv.seg: “God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto Himself.” (2 Corinthians 5:19).
Hnangv yiem 2 Ko^lin^to 5:19 faan zaqv nyei gorngv, “Tin-Hungh yiem Giduc gu’nyuoz, tengx baamh mienh caux Ninh horpc hnyouv.”

tuv.prop: The thorn and the thistle--the difficulties and trials that make his life one of toil and care--were appointed for his good as a part of the training needful in God’s plan for his uplifting from the ruin and degradation that sin has wrought.
In nature itself are messages of hope and comfort.
tuv.seg: The world, though fallen, is not all sorrow and misery.
Maiv gunv baamh gen ndortv njiec aiv, mv baac maiv zeiz kungx maaih kuonx hnyouv nyei sic hnangv.

tuv.prop: Shall we not do all we can to give power to the principles which Christ brought to this world?
tuv.seg: The love expressed on Calvary should be revived, strengthened, and diffused among our churches.
ຄວາມ​ຮັກ​ທີ່​ສະ​ແດງ​ອອກເທິງພູເຂົາຄານວາຣີຄວນ​ໄດ້​ຮັບ​ການ​ຟື້ນ​ຟູ, ເພີ່ມ​ຄວາມ​ເຂັ້ມ​ແຂງ, ແລະແຜ່​ລາມ​ອອກ​ໄປ​ໃນຄຣິສຕະຈັກທັງຫຼາຍ​ຂອງ​ເຮົາ.

tuv.prop: Our Father in heaven is the source of life, of wisdom, and of joy.
tuv.seg: Nature and revelation alike testify of God’s love.
Tin-Hungh zeix daaih nyei ga’naaiv caux Ging-Sou nyei waac fih hnangv nyei biux mengh Tin-Hungh za’gengh maaih hnyouv hnamv mienh.

tuv.prop: “With the help of God, every true believer can see where there is work to be done.
Lean upon the divine arm for wisdom, strength, and skill for the work that God has given you to do.” (OHC 298.4)
tuv.seg: When the human will cooperates with the will of God, it becomes omnipotent, and the worker can make opportunities […] If you will go to work in earnest, ways will open before you for the accomplishment of this work.

tuv.prop: Satan led men to conceive of God as a being whose chief attribute is stern justice,--one who is a severe judge, a harsh, exacting creditor.
It was to remove this dark shadow, by revealing to the world the infinite love of God, that Jesus came to live among men. {SC 10.3}
tuv.seg: He pictured the Creator as a being who is watching with jealous eye to discern the errors and mistakes of men, that He may visit judgments upon them.
Saadaan pien eix leiz gorngv Zeix Lungh Ndau Nyei Ziouv zanc-zanc zaah mangc mienh weic lorz qangx dingc zuiz haaix zanc mienh zoux dorngc.

tuv.prop: It is from the Father’s heart that the streams of divine compassion, manifest in Christ, flow out to the children of men.
It was to redeem us that Jesus lived and suffered and died.
tuv.seg: Jesus, the tender, pitying Saviour, was God “manifest in the flesh.” (1 Timothy 3:16.) {SC 12.2}
Yesu se korv-lienh mienh nyei Njoux Ziouv, se dongh Tin-Hungh “daaih benx yietc dauh baamh mienh bun mienh buatc.” (1 Ti^mo^tai 3:16.) {SC 12.2}

tuv.prop: The principle there illustrated is to give, give.
The principle of worldlings is to get, get, and thus they expect to secure happiness; but, carried out in all its bearings, the fruit is misery and death. {CS 14.2}
tuv.seg: This, carried out in actual benevolence and good works, is the true fruit of the Christian life.

tuv.prop: Jesus did not suppress one word of truth,
He exercised the greatest tact and thoughtful, kind attention in His intercourse with the people.
tuv.seg: but He uttered it always in love.

tuv.prop: God has bound our hearts to Him by unnumbered tokens in heaven and in earth.
Yet these but imperfectly represent His love.
tuv.seg: Through the things of nature, and the deepest and tenderest earthly ties that human hearts can know, He has sought to reveal Himself to us.
Ninh longc Ninh zeix daaih nyei ga’naaiv caux baamh mienh hnamv haic nyei biauv zong mienh weic tengx mbuo hiuv duqv Ninh.

tuv.prop: It is God who supplies the daily needs of all His creatures.
“*The eyes of all wait upon Thee;*\{j}*And Thou givest them their meat in due season.*\{j}*Thou openest Thine hand,*\{j}*And satisfiest the desire of every living thing.”* Psalm 145:15, 16. {SC 9.2}

Naaiv se ei Singx Nzung kuh muangx haic nyei waac gorngv, {SC 9.1}

tuv.prop: Children of the heavenly King! Precious promise!
The matchless love of God for a world that did not love Him!
tuv.seg: Theme for the most profound meditation!
Zungv corngh maiv zaaic yaac hnamv mangc maiv zienz.

tuv.prop: He spoke the truth, but always in love.
but tears were in His voice as He uttered His scathing rebukes.
tuv.seg: He denounced hypocrisy, unbelief, and iniquity;

tuv.prop: Our Father in heaven is the source of life, of wisdom, and of joy.
Think of their marvelous adaptation to the needs and happiness, not only of man, but of all living creatures.
tuv.seg: Look at the wonderful and beautiful things of nature.
Mangc gaax Tin-Hungh zeix daaih nyei ga'naaiv za’gengh nzueic yaac peix fuc haic.

tuv.prop: Every good thing of earth was placed here by the bountiful hand of God as an expression of His love to man.
The gold and the silver are the Lord's; and He could rain them from heaven if He chose.
tuv.seg: The poor are His, and the cause of religion is His.

tuv.prop: The poorest and humblest were not afraid to approach Him.
They loved to climb upon His knees and gaze into the pensive face, benignant with love. {SC 11.2}
tuv.seg: Even little children were attracted to Him.
Liemh fu’jueiv faix yaac hnamv Ninh.

tuv.prop: He was perfect in his being, and in harmony with God.
But through disobedience, his powers were perverted, and selfishness took the place of love.
tuv.seg: His thoughts were pure, his aims holy.
Ninh hnamv nyei jauv caux daav nyei za’eix youc cing-nzengc.

tuv.prop: The love expressed on Calvary should be revived, strengthened, and diffused among our churches.
Shall we not strive to establish and give efficiency to the benevolent enterprises which are now called for without delay?
tuv.seg: Shall we not do all we can to give power to the principles which Christ brought to this world?

tuv.prop: He who had been one with God, felt in His soul the awful separation that sin makes between God and man.
It was the burden of sin, the sense of its terrible enormity, of its separation of the soul from God--it was this that broke the heart of the Son of God. {SC 13.1}
tuv.seg: This wrung from His lips the anguished cry, “My God, My God, why hast Thou forsaken Me?” (Matthew 27:46.)
Ninh ziouc bungx-sing bungx-qiex hnyouv mun nyei gorngv, “Yie nyei Tin-Hungh aah! Yie nyei Tin-Hungh! Meih weic haaix diuc guangc yie?” (Matv^taai 27:46.)

tuv.prop: Though all these evidences have been given, the enemy of good blinded the minds of men, so that they looked upon God with fear; they thought of Him as severe and unforgiving.
He pictured the Creator as a being who is watching with jealous eye to discern the errors and mistakes of men, that He may visit judgments upon them.
tuv.seg: Satan led men to conceive of God as a being whose chief attribute is stern justice,--one who is a severe judge, a harsh, exacting creditor.

tuv.prop: This is one of God's ways of exalting man.
Every good thing of earth was placed here by the bountiful hand of God as an expression of His love to man.
tuv.seg: It is just the work that man needs; for it will stir the deepest sympathies of his heart, and call into exercise the highest capabilities of the mind. {CS 15.1}

tuv.prop: and, failing to find suitable language in which to express the greatness and tenderness of this love, he called upon the world to behold it.

tuv.seg: The thorn and the thistle--the difficulties and trials that make his life one of toil and care--were appointed for his good as a part of the training needful in God’s plan for his uplifting from the ruin and degradation that sin has wrought.

tuv.prop: His heart went out in tender sympathy to the children of men.

Ninh cuotv seix daaih zoux yietc dauh baamh mienh weic tengx duqv taux mienh qiemx zuqc nyei nyungc horngh.

tuv.prop: The gold and the silver are the Lord's; and He could rain them from heaven if He chose.
He thus makes man the medium through which to distribute His blessings on earth.
tuv.seg: But instead of this He has made man His steward, entrusting him with means, not to be hoarded, but to be used in benefiting others.

tuv.prop: This, carried out in actual benevolence and good works, is the true fruit of the Christian life.
The light of the gospel shining from the cross of Christ rebukes selfishness, and encourages liberality and benevolence.
tuv.seg: The principle of worldlings is to get, get, and thus they expect to secure happiness; but, carried out in all its bearings, the fruit is misery and death. {CS 14.2}

tuv.prop: “God so loved the world, that He gave His only-begotten Son.” (John 3:16.)
Christ was the medium through which He could pour out His infinite love upon a fallen world.
tuv.seg: The Father loves us, not because of the great propitiation, but He provided the propitiation because He loves us.

by surrendering My life, by taking your liabilities, your transgressions,

and by beholding we become changed into His image.”

He was never rude, never needlessly spoke a severe word, never gave needless pain to a sensitive soul.
tuv.seg: He exercised the greatest tact and thoughtful, kind attention in His intercourse with the people.

tuv.prop: When Moses prayed, “Show me Thy glory,” the Lord answered, “I will make all My goodness pass before thee.”

tuv.prop: And as we heed these calls, by labor and by acts of benevolence, we are assimilated to the image of Him who for our sakes became poor.
It is the glory of the gospel that it is founded upon the principle of restoring in the fallen race the divine image by a constant manifestation of benevolence.
tuv.seg: In bestowing, we bless others, and thus accumulate true riches. {CS 13.5}

Ninh funx laanh laanh mienh weih jaaix.

tuv.prop: In nature itself are messages of hope and comfort.
“God is love” is written upon every opening bud, upon every spire of springing grass.
tuv.seg: There are flowers upon the thistles, and the thorns are covered with roses. {SC 9.3}
Yiem lomc nyei njimv-cou yaac maaih biangh, njimv-muonc youc maaih biouv. {SC 9.3}

tuv.prop: the more we see mercy, tenderness, and forgiveness blended with equity and justice,
tuv.seg: and the more clearly we discern innumerable evidences of a love that is infinite and a tender pity surpassing a mother’s yearning sympathy for her wayward child. {SC 15.2}

Mbuo yaac gunv mangc duqv cing taux saauv maiv zienz nyei zorng-zengx dongh biux mengh Tin-Hungh maaih hnyouv hnamv mienh yaac korv-lienh mienh zungv gauh camv zoux maa nyei mienh korv-lienh ninh dorngc jauv nyei fu’jueiv. {SC 15.2}

tuv.prop: “With the help of God, every true believer can see where there is work to be done.
If you will go to work in earnest, ways will open before you for the accomplishment of this work.
tuv.seg: When the human will cooperates with the will of God, it becomes omnipotent, and the worker can make opportunities […]
เมื่อพลังแห่งการตัดสินใจของมนุษย์เป็นไปตามน้ำพระทัยของพระเจ้า ความสามารถในการตัดสินใจจะไม่มีขีดจำกัด และผู้รับใช้คนนั้นจะสามารถสร้างโอกาสในการประกาศ …

tuv.prop: should give us exalted conceptions of what we may become through Christ.
he was filled with adoration and reverence;
tuv.seg: As the inspired apostle John beheld the height, the depth, the breadth of the Father’s love toward the perishing race,

Singx Lingh tengx zoux gong-zoh Yo^han bieqc hnyouv taux Tin-Hungh hnamv mienh nyei hnyouv ndongc haaix hlang, ndongc haaix jangv, ndongc haaix ndo—se bieqc hnyouv Tin-Hungh hnamv haic a’lamh zuqc daic nyei mienh maanh.

tuv.prop: By its necessities a ruined world is drawing forth from us talents of means and of influence, to present to men and women the truth, of which they are in perishing need.
In bestowing, we bless others, and thus accumulate true riches. {CS 13.5}
tuv.seg: And as we heed these calls, by labor and by acts of benevolence, we are assimilated to the image of Him who for our sakes became poor.
ແລະເມື່ອພວກເຮົາຕອບສະໜອງຕໍ່ຄໍາຮຽກຮ້ອງເຫຼົ່ານີ້ ໂດຍການເຮັດວຽກ ແລະການຖະວາຍບໍລິຈາກ ພວກເຮົາກໍເປັນເໝືອນພຣະອົງຜູ້ທີ່ຍອມກາຍເປັນຜູ້ທຸກຍາກເພາະເຫັນແກ່ພວກເຮົາ.

tuv.prop: He thus makes man the medium through which to distribute His blessings on earth.
tuv.seg: God planned the system of beneficence, in order that man might become like his Creator, benevolent and unselfish in character, and finally be a partaker with Christ of the eternal, glorious reward. {CS 15.2}
ພຣະເຈົ້າໄດ້ວາງແຜນລະບົບຂອງຜົນປະໂຫຍດ, ເພື່ອໃຫ້ມະນຸດກາຍເປັນຄືກັບຜູ້ສ້າງຂອງລາວ, ມີໃຈເມດຕາແລະບໍ່ເຫັນແກ່ຕົວ, ແລະສຸດທ້າຍໄດ້ມີສ່ວນຮ່ວມກັບພຣະຄຣິດຂອງລາງວັນອັນຮຸ່ງໂລດນິລັນດອນ. {CS 15.2}

tuv.prop: Nothing less than the infinite sacrifice made by Christ in behalf of fallen man could express the Father’s love to lost humanity. {SC 14.2}
He gave Him not only to live among men, to bear their sins, and die their sacrifice.
tuv.seg: “God so loved the world, that He gave His only-begotten Son.”
“Tin-Hungh ndongc naaic hnamv lungh ndiev mienh cingx zorqv ninh nyei ndoqc Dorn ceix bun ninh mbuo.” (Yo^han 3:16.)

tuv.prop: *Thou openest Thine hand,*\ *And satisfiest the desire of every living thing.”*
God made man perfectly holy and happy; and the fair earth, as it came from the Creator’s hand, bore no blight of decay or shadow of the curse.

tuv.seg: (Singx Nzung 145:15, 16.) {SC 9.2}

tuv.prop: Jesus is “not ashamed to call them brethren” (Hebrews 2:11);
And all this that man might be uplifted from the ruin and degradation of sin
tuv.seg: He is our Sacrifice, our Advocate, our Brother, bearing our human form before the Father’s throne, and through eternal ages one with the race He has redeemed--the Son of man.

Yesu siev Ninh ganh nyei maengc daic waic div mbuo. Ninh zoux mbu’ndongx mienh, yaac zoux mbuo nyei Domh Gorx. Ninh yietc liuz yiem Tin-Hungh nyei nza’hmien maaih baamh mienh nyei sin ziouc duqv mbuox heuc Baamh Mienh nyei Dorn—bun cing Ninh daaih zoux yietc dauh dongh Ninh daaih zuoqc nzuonx nyei baamh mienh.

tuv.prop: But instead of this He has made man His steward, entrusting him with means, not to be hoarded, but to be used in benefiting others.

God planned the system of beneficence, in order that man might become like his Creator, benevolent and unselfish in character, and finally be a partaker with Christ of the eternal, glorious reward. {CS 15.2}
tuv.seg: He thus makes man the medium through which to distribute His blessings on earth.
ດັ່ງນັ້ນພຣະອົງຈຶ່ງເຮັດໃຫ້ມະນຸດເປັນສື່ກາງເພື່ອແຈກຢາຍພອນຂອງພຣະອົງເທິງແຜ່ນດິນໂລກ.

tuv.prop: and the fair earth, as it came from the Creator’s hand, bore no blight of decay or shadow of the curse.
Yet even amid the suffering that results from sin, God’s love is revealed.
tuv.seg: It is transgression of God’s law--the law of love--that has brought woe and death.
Laaix mienh baamz Tin-Hungh nyei leiz-latc, se bun cing Tin-Hungh maaih hnyouv hnamv mienh nyei leiz-latc, daic nyei jauv caux yietc zungv zeqc naanc ziouc bieqc daaih naaiv baamh gen.

tuv.prop: He has placed means in the hands of men, that His divine gifts may flow through human channels in doing the work appointed us in saving our fellow men.
It is just the work that man needs; for it will stir the deepest sympathies of his heart, and call into exercise the highest capabilities of the mind. {CS 15.1}
tuv.seg: This is one of God's ways of exalting man.
ນີ້​ແມ່ນ​ວິທີ​ໜຶ່ງ​ຂອງ​ພຣະ​ເຈົ້າ​ໃນ​ການ​ຍົກ​ມະນຸດ.

tuv.prop: Such love is without a parallel.
Theme for the most profound meditation!
tuv.seg: Children of the heavenly King! Precious promise!
Mienh haih zoux Tin-Hungh nyei naamh nyouz se jaaix haic nyei ngaengc waac!

tuv.prop: “Neither knoweth any man the Father, save the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son will reveal Him.”
When one of the disciples made the request, “Show us the Father,” Jesus answered, “Have I been so long time with you, and yet hast thou not known Me, Philip?
tuv.seg: Matthew 11:27.
(Matv^taai 11:27.)

tuv.prop: Yet even amid the suffering that results from sin, God’s love is revealed.

The thorn and the thistle--the difficulties and trials that make his life one of toil and care--were appointed for his good as a part of the training needful in God’s plan for his uplifting from the ruin and degradation that sin has wrought.
tuv.seg: It is written that God cursed the ground for man’s sake. (Genesis 3:17.)

Yiem Tin Deic Douh Sou 3:17 gorngv “Ndau ziouc laaix meih zoux nyei sic zuqc houv.” Mv baac, naaiv yiemc Ging-Sou haih faan daaih gorngv, “Ndau zuqc houv weic tengx meih” ei leiz se weic tengx mienh maanh.

tuv.prop: There were whole villages where there was not a moan of sickness in any house, for He had passed through them and healed all their sick.
tuv.seg: He went about doing good and healing all that were oppressed by Satan.
Ninh mingh norm-norm dorngx zoux kuv sic yaac zorc longx yietc zungv zuqc Saadaan hoic nyei mienh.

tuv.prop: He went about doing good and healing all that were oppressed by Satan.
His work gave evidence of His divine anointing.
tuv.seg: There were whole villages where there was not a moan of sickness in any house, for He had passed through them and healed all their sick.

Maaix ziex norm laangz maiv maaih haaix dauh butv baengc yaac maiv maaih yietc deix njunh nyei qiex mbui yiem haaix dauh nyei biauv, weic zuqc Ninh zueih mungv zueih laangz yangh jiex ninh mbuo yiem nyei dorngx yaac zorc longx ninh mbuo nyei yietc zungv baengc tongx baengc zingh.
